items.title: Intro
items.text: Learn how to connect your WhatsApp account to Messcat using the QR code integration method, similar to how WhatsApp Web works.
path: How to Connect your Whatsapp to MessCat? (QR Integration)

items.title: Step
items.text:
1. Login: Access your Messcat account.

  2. Go to Manage Channel: Find Manage Channel in the menu on the side.

    ![image.png](How%20to%20Connect%20your%20Whatsapp%20to%20MessCat%20(QR%20Integr/image.png)

  3. Pick or Make a Channel:

    ![image.png](How%20to%20Connect%20your%20Whatsapp%20to%20MessCat%20(QR%20Integr/image%201.png)

    • Choose the channel you want to link.
    • If you need a new channel, click 'Create New'. Important: If you use more than one channel, there will be a monthly fee or credits used.
    • Generate QR Code: Click the Scan QR button. A unique QR code will pop up on your screen, just like it does when you log in to WhatsApp Web.

![image.png](How%20to%20Connect%20your%20Whatsapp%20to%20MessCat%20(QR%20Integr/image%202.png)

![image.png](How%20to%20Connect%20your%20Whatsapp%20to%20MessCat%20(QR%20Integr/image%203.png)

  1. Scan with WhatsApp:
    • Open WhatsApp on your mobile phone.
    • Go to Settings > Linked Devices.
    • Tap on Link a Device.
    • Point your phone's camera at the QR code displayed on your Messcat screen to scan it.
path: How to Connect your Whatsapp to MessCat? (QR Integration)

items.title: What Happens Next
items.text: After you scan the code, Messcat will start syncing with your WhatsApp. Wait about 5 to 10 minutes for your chats and contacts to show up. If you have lots of contacts or old messages, it might take more time.
path: How to Connect your Whatsapp to MessCat? (QR Integration)

items.title: Why does it say "Waiting..."?
items.text: Answer: This means Messcat is still loading your old chat messages. Please wait. Don't worry or scan the QR code again and again. Scanning again won't make it faster.
path: How to Connect your Whatsapp to MessCat? (QR Integration)

items.title: Why don't Read/Unread marks match sometimes?
items.text: Answer: Sometimes WhatsApp doesn't tell Messcat right away when you read a message. Because of this, the read/unread marks might not always match perfectly between WhatsApp and Messcat. (Read more here: Understanding Chat Action Sync)
path: How to Connect your Whatsapp to MessCat? (QR Integration)

items.title: Types of WhatsApp Accounts
path: What is Whatsapp Official Business API?

items.title: 1. Personal WhatsApp Account
items.text: A personal WhatsApp account is designed for individual use. It allows users to send messages, make voice and video calls, share files, and more for personal use.
path: What is Whatsapp Official Business API?

items.title: 2. WhatsApp Business Account
items.text: WhatsApp Business is intended for small businesses to communicate with their customers. It has a separate app (WA Business) and offers additional features tailored for business use such as a business profile, quick replies, basic automated messages and labels.
path: What is Whatsapp Official Business API?

items.title: 3. WhatsApp Business API Account
items.text:
The WhatsApp Business API is designed for medium to large businesses to communicate with customers at scale. It acts as¬†a backend mechanism that allows businesses to manage and automate their conversations on WhatsApp. Instead of a tangible app or interface that one might use on a personal device, the API is integrated into other messaging platforms (Messcat) or systems businesses already use. Refer to the link below for more information‚Äì

Business Platform | WhatsApp Business
path: What is Whatsapp Official Business API?

items.title: Limitations of WhatsApp Business API
items.text: There are some Limitations to using the Whatsapp Business API, helpful to know before you apply for registration.

items.title: Pre-Onboarding:
items.text:
• If onboarded with a WhatsApp Business API solution provider (like Messcat), the previous chats cannot be seen
  • If onboarded with a WhatsApp Business API solution provider (like Messcat), the number cannot be used on any other WhatsApp apps - including the WhatsApp & WhatsApp Business mobile app.

items.title: Post Onboarding:
items.text:
• A WABA can have a maximum of 250 message templates.
  • Meta Business Accounts are initially limited to 2 registered business phone numbers, but this limit can be increased to up to 20.
  • A WABA must belong to only one Business Manager. You cannot have two or more Business Managers owning one WABA.
  • Businesses can send messages by manually typing to customers only after a customer initiates a message. These messages are called session messages and can be sent by businesses to customers within 24 hours.
  • After 24 hours, the session expires and businesses can only send 'template messages' to their users. Template messages must be pre-approved by WhatsApp and can be done from the Messcatdashboard
  • All template messages must adhere to WhatsApp Commerce Policies.
  • The WhatsApp Group Feature is not supported
  • WhatsApp profile pictures cannot be seen if using WABA
  • WhatsApp Voice or Video Calls are not supported. Voice notes are supported.
  • The WhatsApp Message Forwarding Feature is not supported
  • WhatsApp apps cannot be used with the same number if using WhatsApp Business APIs
  • WhatsApp Messages cannot be replied to in a thread
  • Message template button can only include one URL button/ Phone number. Duplicated URL and Phone Number in one messages templates is limited.
  • WhatsApp Business APIs do not display link previews for ads when a new message is received from the ads.
  • WhatsApp Business APIs doesn‚Äôt support deleting of a message.

items.title: Phase 2: Verify your Business on Meta
items.text:
Step to verify your Facebook Business

To start business account verification, ensure eligibility and control over the account. If the "Start verification" button is not visible in the Security Centre, check if verification is required for desired features, based on any received notifications or emails.

Misrepresenting information or unauthorised claims during verification can lead to denial of verification, removal of verified status, or additional actions by Meta.

‚ùó **Note**: Meta business accounts, sometimes called Business Manager accounts, are now called business portfolios. This change will appear gradually across Meta technologies.

  1. Navigate to the Security Centre in Business Manager and click "Start Verification."
  2. Enter your business details and click "Next."
  3. Choose your business from the provided list or select "None of these match" if not listed.
  4. Select a verification method: Phone call, Text Message, Email Verification, or Domain Verification.
    1. For Phone or Text, provide a document with your organization's name and phone number.
    2. Email Verification is the quickest method.
    3. For Domain Verification, use an already verified domain or verify your domain and then continue.
  5. Upload documents to confirm your Business Name & Address.
    1. Documents required for Facebook Business Verification You'll need to provide one of the following documents to verify your business:
      1. Organizations. If you're a registered business or organization, please provide one of the following:
        1. Government-issued company or corporate registration.
        2. Company tax revenue document (for example, a corporate tax return or tax-exempt certificate).
        3. Official articles of incorporation or association.
      2. Sole proprietors If you're a registered sole proprietor and operate your business by yourself, please submit one of the document types listed below:
        1. A government registration document. This document must confirm that you are a sole proprietor.
        2. Company tax filing document.
      3. If you're not a registered business or sole proprietor, please submit the requested ID below:
        1. Proof of ID. This must be a valid government-issued identification document that includes a photograph, preferably a passport.
        2. Proof of address. Note that your document must clearly show the address you registered with Facebook, must be in effect, and must be no more than 6 months old. Acceptable proof can include you:
          1. Utility bill.
          2. Bank statement.
          3. Credit card statement.
          4. Company tax filing documents.
‚ùó ***Note: The image of your document must be clear, in color, and show the whole document. The document submitted cannot be expired or altered in any way. Note: Messcatis not responsible for Facebook Business Verification. The ultimate right to verify a business lies with Facebook.***
  1. Choose an accepted document type for upload.
  2. If the document includes a phone number or address, confirm in the next step.
  3. Provide your business email and enter the verification code received.
  4. Click "Submit" to finish.
  5. Once submitted, wait for confirmation of verification. Check your status in the Security Centre.
path: How to get a Meta Business Manager Account and verify your Business on Meta? (required for Official Whatsapp Business API)

items.title: FAQ
items.text:
1. How to check if your business is verified?

    1. Log into your Facebook Business Manager account and click on 'Business Settings'.
    2. Select 'Security Center'.
    3. View the verification status displayed.
    4. What if the 'Start Verification' button is greyed? Meta may prevent your business from being verified if the submission does not meet the requirements for verification. This could include:
    5. Submitting, or being suspected of submitting false or misleading information
    6. Attempting to claim or verify a business account you don't own or have authorization to represent
    7. Trying to circumvent Meta's verification review system
    8. Having a website that fails to load, is not HTTPS compliant, or contains a link that leads to an error message

    If your business verification application was rejected, you may be eligible to appeal. Visit the Security Centre or return to where you began the verification process to learn more about the status of your verification.

  2. After I submitted my business details, I saw a list of business records. What should I choose if none of the businesses listed match? If META can find a public record that matches your business details, you will see a list of business records. You may either select the correct record from the list or select My business isn't listed or None of these matches.

  3. Do I need to submit documents if I use monthly invoicing to pay for ads? If you use monthly invoicing to pay for ads, you don't need to submit documentation for business verification. When you start the business verification process, you can fill in the form with your line of credit information and submit it. If you can't see that option, make sure that the business account you're trying to verify is linked to a credit line that you own, not one that is shared with another business.

items.text: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Np2RU0cw0zASitPE0DLjFRu942TiiI9A/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Np2RU0cw0zASitPE0DLjFRu942TiiI9A/view?usp=sharing)

items.title: Steps
items.text:
1. Go to "Channels": In Messcat, find and click on the "Channels" section.
  2. Add a Channel: Click the button that says "+ Channel."
  3. Pick Instagram: Choose "Instagram" from the list.
  4. Log In to Instagram: You'll be taken to Instagram to sign in to your account.
  5. Give Messcat Permission:
    • Choose the Instagram Business account and Facebook Page you want to use with Messcat.
    • You'll see a list of things Messcat needs permission to do. This is normal, and it lets Messcat manage your Instagram messages.
  6. Save Everything: Click "Save" or "Confirm" to finish connecting.
  7. All Done! Your Instagram Channel is now connected to Messcat! You'll see it in your "Channels" section.

items.title: Important Things to Know
items.text:
• Business Account Only: Remember, you need an Business account, not a personal one.
  • Linked to Facebook: Your Instagram Business account must be connected to a Facebook Page.
  • The 24-Hour Rule: Instagram has a rule that says:
    • You can message someone freely within 24 hours after they messaged you.
    • After 24 hours, you can't message them first unless they message you again.
  • Old Messages: Messages that existed before connecting to Messcat will not appear in Messcat.
  • Using Meta Business Suite: If you use the Meta Business Suite to message people, those messages might not appear in Messcat. It's best to use Messcat for your Instagram messages after you connect.
  • File Size Limits:
    • Pictures: 8MB limit
    • Other Files: 25MB limit

items.title: Help! I'm Having Trouble!
items.text:
• Channel Connection Problems:
    • Make sure you're logged in to the right Instagram Business account.
    • Double-check that your Instagram Business account is linked to a Facebook Page.
    • Make sure you've allowed all the permissions that Messcat needs.
  • Message Problems:
    • Manage your messages only in Messcat to avoid sync issues with other platforms like Meta Business Suite.
  • Billing:
    • If you're redirected to the payment page, your account has run out of credits.

items.title: Messages Types
items.text: We support two types of messages: free-form messages and template messages. Template messages can only be sent to a user who has opted-in to allow a business to send messages to them. When using template messages, a template is required and must be approved by the review team before sending messages to customers.

items.title: What are Template Messages?
items.text: Template messages are a specialized form of communication utilized in marketing, utility, and authentication interactions with customers. These templates are essential for initiating conversations with customers who have either not yet contacted the business or have not communicated in the past 24 hours. Before usage, these templates require approval and are subject to deactivation based on customer feedback. If disabled due to poor quality ratings or policy violations, they cannot be used until these issues are resolved.

items.title: How to Submit Templates for Review (WABA)
items.text: Please refer to: submit template for review

items.title: Message Flow Limitations (WABA)
items.text:
While creating a message template to submit for review for WABA account, please refer below for the message template‚Äôs setting limitations.

| Button | Either [URL button] or [phone number button] The combination will be either one of the below: 1. new message + URL button 2. new message + phone number button 3. new message + new message

  • Maximum of 25 characters in Button name. | | --- | --- | | Delay | [Delay] action cannot apply to the ‚ÄúStarting Step‚Äù message. | | User Input | [User input] feature is not allowed. | | Voice Message | [Voice Message] cannot be inserted. | | Image | media files format: image/jpeg, image/png maximum size: 5MB

Images must be 8-bit, RGB or RGBA | | Video | media files format: video/mp4, video/3gp maximum size: 16MB

Notes: - Only H.264 video codec and AAC audio codec is supported. - We support videos with a single audio stream or no audio stream. |

items.title: Common Message Flow Rejection Reasons (WABA)
items.text:
Submissions are commonly rejected for the following reasons, so make sure you avoid these mistakes.

  • Variable parameters are missing or have mismatched curly braces. The correct format is {{1}}.
  • Variable parameters contain special characters such as a #, $, or %.
  • The message template contains content that violates WhatsApp‚Äôs Commerce Policy: When you offer goods or services for sale, we consider all messages and media related to your goods or services, including any descriptions, prices, fees, taxes and/or any required legal disclosures, to constitute transactions. Transactions must comply with the WhatsApp Commerce Policy.
  • The message template contains content that violates the WhatsApps Business Policy: Do not request sensitive identifiers from users. For example, do not ask people to share full length individual payment card numbers, financial account numbers, National Identification numbers, or other sensitive identifiers. This also includes not requesting documents from users that might contain sensitive identifiers. Requesting partial identifiers (ex: last 4 digits of their Social Security number) is OK.
  • The content contains potentially abusive or threatening content, such as threatening a customer with legal action or threatening to publicly shame them.
  • The message template is a duplicate of an existing template. If a template is submitted with the same wording in the body and footer of an existing template, the duplicate template will be rejected.

A rejection notification that includes the rejection reason will appear in Business Support Home. You can view rejections in the Business Support Home by navigating to Account Overview > View my accounts (button) > (your Meta Business Account) > (your WABA) > Rejected message templates. Rejection info will also be sent via email.

You can refer to the Business Support Home notification to see the name and language of the existing template with the same content as the rejected duplicate template. You may also choose to edit the template and resubmit. This check does not apply to templates categorized as AUTHENTICATION.

items.title: Messages Template Status (WABA)
items.text:
Templates can have the following statuses.

  • In-Review: Indicates that the template is still under review. Review can take up to 24 hours.
  • Rejected: The template has been rejected during our review process or violates one or more of our policies.
  • Active - Quality pending: The message template has yet to receive quality feedback from customers. Message templates with this status can be sent to customers.
  • Active - High Quality: The template has received little to no negative customer feedback. Message templates with this status can be sent to customers.
  • Active - Medium Quality: The template has received negative feedback from multiple customers but may soon become paused or disabled. Message templates with this status can be sent to customers.
  • Active - Low Quality: The template has received negative feedback from multiple customers. Message templates with this status can be sent to customers but are in danger of being paused or disabled soon, so we recommend that you address the issues that customers are reporting.
  • Paused: The template has been paused due to recurring negative feedback from customers. Message templates with this status cannot be sent to customers.
  • Disabled: The template has been disabled due to recurring negative feedback from customers. Message templates with this status cannot be sent to customers.
  • Appeal Requested: Indicates that an appeal has been requested. See Appeals. The appeal will be reviewed and a decision made within 24 hours.

You can view a template's status by going to WhatsApp Manager > Overview, mousing over the suitcase icon (Account tools) and clicking Message templates. If you have multiple WhatsApp Business Accounts, select the account whose template statuses you want to view from the list of accounts in the dropdown menu in the top-right corner.

items.title: Message Sending Limits (WABA)
items.text:
Business phone numbers with a connected status and approved display name can initiate conversations with the following number of unique customers in a rolling 24-hour period:

  • 1K business-initiated conversations
  • 10K business-initiated conversations
  • 100K business-initiated conversations
  • An unlimited number of business-initiated conversations

This amount starts at 1K unique customers and scales automatically based on phone number status, phone number quality rating, and how often you initiate conversations with unique customers.

items.title: How to Increase Your Message Limit
items.text:
Each time you initiate a new conversation with a unique customer, WhatsApp will determine if your limit should be increased. This determination is based on the following criteria:

  • Your phone number status is Connected
  • Your phone number quality rating is Medium or High
  • In the last 7 days, you have initiated X or more conversations with unique customers, where X is your current messaging limit divided by 2
üí° ***If you meet all conditions, WhatsApp will increase your messaging limit by one level in 24 hours.***

items.title: How to check your message limit
items.text: • You can check your current messaging limits in the WhatsApp Manager > Overview Dashboard > Insights tab. The panel depicted below will only show your current limit if your messaging limit has increased from the default limit of 250.

items.title: How to maintain a high-quality message template?
items.text:
• Make sure messages follow WhatsApp's Business Policy and Commerce Policy.
  • Only send messages to users who have opted into receiving messages from your business.
  • Make the messages highly personalized and useful to users. Avoid sending open-ended welcome or introductory messages.
  • Be mindful of messaging frequency; avoid sending customers too many messages a day. Be thoughtful of informational messages, optimizing for content and length.

items.title: Why is my message limit being decreased?
items.text: • Each time you initiate a new conversation with a unique customer we will check your phone number quality rating. If the rating has been flagged for the last 7 days, we will immediately decrease your messaging limit by one level.

  4. Press the ‚Äúreply‚Äù button on the comment, type in your reply and press send! This will privately reply and open a private DM chat with them. Public replies on comments are not supported at the moment

items.title: Silencing Comments in Inbox
items.text:
If you have a busy or host lots of lives, comments can become intrusive in your inbox. So, to help you have a clear inbox ‚Äî you can turn off notifications & unread indicator for all or some comments, without affecting comment automations. To achieve this:

  1. Navigate to Manage Channels, and open the Messenger/Instagram channel for which you would like to silence comments

  2. Scroll down to find the ‚ÄúSilence Comments‚Äù setting. There you will have 4 options:

    1. None (default): no comments shall be silenced, and all comments will send a notification & mark the chat unread.
    2. On Ongoing Live Videos: comments on ongoing live videos will be silenced. Comments received after the live video is over will not be silenced
    3. On All Live Videos (Ongoing & Ended): comments on all live videos, that are ongoing & over, will be silenced.
    4. On All Posts: comments on all posts will be silenced ‚Äî including posts, reels, live videos, etc.

Note: silenced comments will be visible in inbox, if you have an existing chat with the commenter. If no chat was present with the commenter when they commented, then the comment will not be accessible in the inbox till you send a reply or they DM you.

items.title: Limitations
items.text:
1. Only one reply per comment is permitted by Meta. To send any further messages to the chat, you must wait for the person to respond.
  2. Replies must be sent within 7 days of the comment being received. Any reply must quote the original comment to be recognised as a ‚Äúprivate reply‚Äù and not a DM
  3. If the comment is deleted before you send a reply, you will also not be able to send a reply.

items.title: Why This Matters
items.text:
Moving from Another App to Messcat

If you're switching from another messaging app to Messcat for your Facebook Page, you need to tell Facebook to send your messages to Messcat instead of the old app. This is done by changing the "Primary Receiver." Without this step, you might not get any messages in Messcat!

items.text: Think of it like a mailbox. Facebook needs to know which app should get your messages. The "Primary Receiver" is the app that Facebook sends messages to.

items.title: How to Change the Primary Receiver to Messcat
Follow Meta's Official Guide
items.text: You can follow the official steps listed in Meta's guide here.

items.title: Or Follow Our Step-by-Step Instructions
items.text:
Step 1: Open Your Facebook Page

  • Go to Facebook and open the Page you want to use with Messcat.
  • Make sure you are an admin of that page.

Step 2: Switch to Page View

  • On the left side of your Facebook page, scroll down to the bottom.

  • You will see a "Switch" button, click on it.

  • On the left side menu, find and click "Settings."

items.title: Intro
items.text:
Do you find your inbox getting overwhelmed with comments, especially during live streams? Messcat's "Silence Comments" setting can help you manage the noise!

This guide explains how to control which comment notifications appear in your inbox, allowing you to keep it clean and focused.

items.title: Why Silence Comments?
items.text:
If you have a very active community or frequently host live videos, the constant stream of comments can make it hard to find important messages. Silencing comments helps you:

  • Reduce clutter: Hide notifications for certain types of comments.
  • Stay focused: Prioritize direct messages and other important conversations.
  • Maintain automation: Comment automations still work, even if notifications are silenced.

items.title: Here's How to Silence Comments
items.text:
Step 1: Go to Manage Channels

  • Open your Messcat account.
  • Navigate to "Manage Channels."

Step 2: Open Your Channel Settings

  • Select the Messenger or Instagram channel where you want to adjust comment notifications.

Step 3: Find "Silence Comments"

  • Scroll down within your channel settings to find the "Silence Comments" setting.

Step 4: Choose Your Preference

  • You'll see four options. Choose the one that best fits your needs:

    • None (default):
      • All comments will send a notification and mark the chat as unread.
      • This is the standard setting.
    • On Ongoing Live Videos:
      • Comments made during live video streams will be silenced.
      • Comments received after the live video ends will still trigger notifications.
    • On All Live Videos (Ongoing & Ended):
      • All comments on live videos will be silenced, whether the video is currently live or has finished.
    • On All Posts:
      • All comments on all types of posts (regular posts, Reels, live videos, etc.) will be silenced.

items.title: Important Note on Silenced Comments
items.text:
• Existing Chats: If you already have a conversation with someone, their comments will still be visible in that existing chat in your inbox.
  • New Chats: If someone comments and you don't have a previous chat with them, their comment will not create a new chat in your inbox. You will only see their comment if:
  • They send you a direct message (DM).

items.title: Example Scenario
items.text: You choose "On Ongoing Live Videos." During your live stream, comments won't clutter your inbox. However, if someone comments on the replay of that live stream later, you will receive a notification.

items.title: Key Takeaway
items.text: The "Silence Comments" setting gives you granular control over comment notifications, allowing you to optimize your Messcat inbox for efficiency.

items.title: Intro
items.text: This document outlines the limitations imposed by Meta (Facebook/Instagram) when privately responding to comments through Messcat. Understanding these limitations is crucial for effective comment management and automation.

items.title: Meta's API Restrictions and Their Impact
items.text: Meta's API, which Messcat uses to interact with Instagram and Messenger, has specific rules to protect user privacy and prevent spam. These rules result in the following limitations:
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 1. One Private Reply Per Comment
items.text:
• Limitation: Meta allows only one private reply (DM) per comment.
  • Impact:
    • You cannot send multiple automated or manual replies to a single comment.
      • For example, you can only send either an image or a message as a single reply, but not both separately.
    • This enforces a more conversational approach, encouraging users to initiate further communication.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 2. 7-Day Reply Window
items.text:
• Limitation: You have a 7-day window from the comment's creation to send a private reply.
  • Impact:
    • Prompt responses are essential. Delayed replies will fail.
    • This encourages timely engagement and prevents stale conversations.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 3. Quoting the Original Comment
items.text:
• Limitation: To ensure your message is recognized as a "private reply" and not a standalone DM, your response must quote the original comment.
  • Impact:
    • Messcat handles this automatically when using the "reply" function.
    • If you attempt to send a DM without quoting the comment, it might not be delivered correctly.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 4. Deleted Comments
items.text:
• Limitation: If a comment is deleted (by the user or by Meta) before you send a reply, you cannot send a private response.
  • Impact:
    • You lose the opportunity to engage with that user.
    • This emphasizes the importance of responding to comments quickly.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 5. Instagram Specific limitations
items.text:
• Limitation: Instagram replies are subjected to rate limits.
  • Impact:
    • High volume of automatic replies in a short period of time can cause errors.
    • It is recommended to implement some delay between automated replies.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: 6. Messenger Specific limitations
items.text:
• Limitation: Messenger replies are subjected to the 24 hours messaging window.
  • Impact:
    • After a 24 hours window, you will not able to send any messages until the user send a message again.
    • It is recommended to keep the conversation within the 24 hours window.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

items.title: Best Practices for Navigating Limitations
items.text:
• Prioritize Timeliness: Respond to comments promptly to maximize engagement within the 7-day window.
  • Encourage User Interaction: Since you're limited to one reply, focus on creating messages that encourage users to DM you for further conversation.
  • Monitor Comment Activity: Regularly check your posts for new comments to ensure you don't miss any within the 7-day window.
  • Use Automation Wisely: While automation is powerful, be mindful of Meta's limitations and avoid excessive or spam-like behavior.
  • Inform users: If you are running an automation, let the user know, that they will recive a DM, to prevent confusion.
path: Understanding Comment Reply Limitations on Instagram and Messenger (Messcat)

Messcat is designed to streamline your comment management while adhering to Meta's API limitations. It provides tools to:

By understanding and respecting these limitations, you can effectively use Messcat to engage with your audience and build stronger relationships on Instagram and Messenger.

items.title: Messenger/Instagram Channel FAQs
items.text: Here's a breakdown of common issues and solutions for Messenger and Instagram messages not appearing or functioning correctly in Messcat:

items.title: Why am I not getting any Messenger or Instagram messages in Messcat?
items.text:
• No Facebook Business Page:
    • Messcat requires a connected Facebook Business Page for Messenger integration. Personal Messenger accounts are not supported.
    • Ensure you have created and linked a Facebook Business Page.

  • Not Connected to Messcat:

    • Verify that your Facebook Page is properly connected to Messcat.
    • Navigate to "Manage Channels" within Messcat.
    • Confirm that your page displays "Connected" along with the page's name.
    • Wrong Facebook Account:
    • Double-check that you're looking at the messages on your Facebook Business Page, not your personal Facebook profile.
    • Another App is the Primary Receiver:
    • Facebook allows only one application to manage messages from a page at a time.
    • If another application is set as the "Primary Receiver," Messcat will not receive messages.
    • Messages Sent from Another Platform:
    • If the messages were sent using a platform outside of Messcat, they will not be shown within Messcat. Only the messages that are sent and recieved through Messcat will be visible.

items.title: Why are some chat names missing in Messcat?
items.text:
• User Privacy:
    • The user may have configured their Facebook privacy settings to hide their name.
  • Deleted User:
    • The user's Facebook account might have been deleted or flagged as spam.
  • Permission Issue:
    • Messcat may lack the necessary permissions to retrieve the user's name.

    • To resolve this:

      • Go to "Manage Channels" in Messcat.
      • Locate your Messenger channel.
      • Click the "Relink" button.
      • If the user sends a new message, their name should appear.

items.title: Why don't I see old Messenger chats in Messcat?
items.text:
• Facebook's API restricts applications from accessing messages that were sent before the connection was established.
  • Consequently, Messcat will only display messages received after you connect your Messenger account.

items.title: Why am I getting an error when I try to send a message?
items.text:
• "Error validating access token":

    • This error typically occurs when you've logged out of Facebook or changed your password.
    • Fix: Navigate to "Manage Channels" in Messcat and click "Relink with Meta" for your Messenger channel.
    • "Message failed to send because another app is controlling this thread now":
    • Only one application can manage a message thread at a time.
    • Fix: Relink with Meta and ensure Messcat is the primary receiver.
    • "(#10)Message is being sent outside the allowed window":

    • Facebook enforces a 24-hour standard messaging window for automated responses.
    • After 24 hours only manually sent messages are allowed within a 7 day window, and must be used to follow up on a issue or provide assistance.
    • Fix: You must reply within 24 hours of the customer messaging you for automated messages, and 7 days for manually sent messages. Please refer to this guide for Meta‚Äôs full policy.

items.text: QR based WhatsApp integrations are like WhatsApp web connections with Messcat. This means that they will have all the limitations of WhatsApp Web but with powerful Messcat features.

items.title: Why are some of my previous chats missing?
items.text:
If you‚Äôve recently connected a channel and the status shows that ‚Äúwaiting for chat history sync‚Äù then it is very likely that chats are syncing. If the volume of chats is large, it can take longer to sync, with some possible data loss in the process.

If the status instead shows that chat history sync is completed, and even then some of the chat history is missing. Then as mentioned earlier, QR based integrations suffer from all the limitations of WhatsApp Web. One of them being that chat history synced is sometimes not complete. This is a limitation that cannot be fixed.

To know more about this, please refer to the official WhatsApp article regarding chat history sync issues here.

items.title: Where can I see missing old chats?
items.text:
Missing old chats should always be present on the primary WhatsApp device i.e. your phone. So, incase some chats are missing on Messcat but need to be accessed, your primary device is your best bet.

In some cases, we may be able to fetch older messages inside a chat, in that case the option to do so when scrolled to the topmost message in a chat. If, however, that option isn‚Äôt available/visible then it‚Äôs not possible.

items.title: Why are new chats after connecting to Messcat not syncing?
items.text:
If your new chats are not syncing with Messcat follow these steps ‚Äì

  1. Ensure your channel is connected by visiting the Manage Channels.
  2. Refresh the page.

In most cases the above two steps will fix the issue. If not, then please report the issue and our team will look into it.

items.title: Will rescanning the QR code help in syncing all old messages?
items.text:
Rescanning QR code may or may not help in syncing all old messages. This is because when a channel is re-connected, the data received from WhatsApp can differ in its contents. In some cases, your issue may resolve, in other cases it may not. This is a limitation of QR based integrations.

It is important to note that rescanning the QR code may cause additional delays as lots of new data needs to be processed. It is suggested that rescanning, if done, should be done during non-working hours to avoid disruptions during business hours

items.title: Why Can't I View Older Attachments (Images/Videos/PDFs/Other Files)?
items.text:
Attachments are only available if they are downloaded on your mobile device. If an attachment has expired or cannot be downloaded on your phone, it will show an error in Messcat.

Tips: Please enable auto-download in your WhatsApp mobile app to ensure all attachments are available.

items.title: What is Chat History Sync?
items.text:
By default, Messcat syncs your WhatsApp chat history and makes it available in the inbox. The time taken to sync this history depends on the size of your chat history.

Due to limitations of a QR based integration discussed earlier in this section, there might be some possible data loss during such a chat history sync, depending on the data sent to us by WhatsApp. This is a platform limitation.

Chat history sync is enabled by default. However, you can choose to disable chat history sync depending on your requirements.

Some possible cases where you may want to disable chat history sync.

  1. You do not want older chat history to sync on Messcat.
  2. You want to speed up the connection process and do not need chat history.
  3. You want to connect another number in the same channel (not advised) and want to preserve history from the older channel.
path: How to enable/disable Chat History Sync?

items.title: How to Enable/Disable Chat History Sync
items.text:
1. Navigate to the "Manage Channels" > Select Your WhatsApp Channel > 3-dot menu > Show Advanced Settings

  2. Locate the Chat History Sync option in the Modal (first one).

  3. Click the checkbox to enable/disable the feature.

‚ùó Disabling Chat History Sync will prevent future chat history from being synced.
path: How to enable/disable Chat History Sync?

items.title: Understanding Chat Action Sync
items.text: Learn how to keep your WhatsApp and Messcat experiences synchronized. You'll also learn how to disable this feature if you prefer to manage your chats independently.

items.title: What is Chat Action Sync?
items.text: Chat Action Sync is a feature designed to keep your WhatsApp and Messcat experiences aligned. It synchronizes actions like pinning, archiving, and marking messages as read or unread between the two platforms. This means that changes you make in one app will be reflected in the other.

items.title: Why Might It Not Always Work Perfectly?
items.text: Due to technical limitations on WhatsApp's end, we can't always receive accurate action information. This can prevent seamless synchronization, leading to minor discrepancies between the platforms in read/unread status or chat organization.

items.title: When Should You Turn Off Chat Action Sync?
items.text:
Here are simple reasons why you might want to turn off Chat Action Sync:

  • Separate Control: When you want to handle your chats action differently in WhatsApp and Messcat
  • Privacy: When you don't want your WhatsApp chat action to show up in Messcat
  • Testing: When you want to try Messcat features without changing anything in WhatsApp
  • Quick Break: When you need to temporarily pause sync due to issues or personal preference
  • Channel Connection Problems: When your WhatsApp channel keeps disconnecting and affecting your operations

items.title: How to Disable Chat Action Sync ?
items.text:
If you prefer to manage your chats independently in each app, you can disable Chat Action Sync:

  1. Navigate to the "Manage Channels" > Select Your WhatsApp Channel > 3-dot menu > Disconnect the Channel

  2. Click the 3-dot menu and choose Settings.

  3. Uncheck Enable Chat Action Sync.

items.title: What Happens When You Disable Sync?
items.text:
You'll need to manage chat actions (like pinning, archiving, or marking as read) separately in each app.

üí° **We recommend keeping Chat Action Sync enabled** for a more seamless experience, but understand that disabling it might be necessary in certain situations.

items.title: How Can I Fix Read/Unread Status Issues?
items.text: Unfortunately, we face limitations on WhatsApp's side that prevent us from getting accurate read/unread status data. However, there's a helpful feature in the inbox filter that can assist you. In the inbox filter, you'll find "Chats Not Replied" under Filter > More (scroll down to find it). This filter shows all chats that have not been replied to.

items.title: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Issue
items.text: Due to WhatsApp's multi-device sync limitations, messages sent through WhatsApp Web-based connections may not appear on the sender's mobile device, even though recipients can see them. This is a known behavior of WhatsApp's infrastructure when using web or QR-based connections.
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Explanation
items.text:
1. Messcat‚Äôs QR-Based Integration Limitations
    • Messcat connects to WhatsApp similarly to WhatsApp Web, inheriting its sync limitations. Messages sent via Messcat are stored on the connected device (Messcat) but may fail to sync back to your mobile due to:
      • Partial Sync: WhatsApp Web/QR integrations only sync messages from the time of connection onward. Older chats or recent messages might not fully sync to the mobile device .
      • Technical Delays: Large chat volumes or server-side delays can cause temporary sync gaps .
      • Chat Action Sync Conflicts: If Messcat‚Äôs "Chat Action Sync" feature is enabled, actions like marking messages as read may conflict with mobile sync .
  2. Data Flow Limitation
    • WhatsApp prioritizes the primary device (your mobile) as the source of truth. Messages sent via Messcat are stored on its servers but may not retroactively update your mobile‚Äôs local database .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Step-by-Step Solutions
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Re-Link Messcat to WhatsApp
items.text:
• Steps:
    • Log out of Messcat: Go to Manage Channels > Select WhatsApp Channel > 3-dot Menu > Disconnect .
    • On your phone: Open WhatsApp > Linked Devices > Log Out all devices sessions .
    • Re-scan Messcat‚Äôs QR code via Linked Devices > Link a Device .
  • Why: Forces a fresh sync and resolves temporary connection glitches.
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Check Chat History Sync Status
items.text:
• In Messcat, navigate to Manage Channels > WhatsApp Channel Status:
    • If status shows ‚ÄúWaiting for chat history sync‚Äù, wait 5‚Äì10 minutes for large volumes to sync .
    • If status is ‚ÄúSync completed‚Äù but messages are missing, retrieve them directly from your mobile (primary device) .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Disable Chat Action Sync
items.text:
• Go to Manage Channels > WhatsApp Channel > 3-dot Menu > Settings > Uncheck ‚ÄúEnable Chat Action Sync‚Äù .
  • Why: Prevents conflicts in read/unread statuses between Messcat and your mobile.
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Verify Network Stability
items.text: • Ensure both your mobile and Messcat-connected device have stable internet. Weak connectivity disrupts real-time sync .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Avoid Re-Scanning QR Codes Repeatedly
items.text: • Re-scanning deletes and re-syncs all chats, potentially causing data loss or delays. Only re-scan during non-working hours if necessary .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Additional Tips
items.text:
• Missing Older Chats: Access them directly on your mobile. Messcat cannot retroactively sync messages sent before the initial connection .
  • App Updates: Ensure Messcat and WhatsApp are updated to the latest versions to avoid compatibility issues .
  • Multi-Device Limitations: Messcat‚Äôs multi-device support is in beta. Avoid simultaneous logins on other devices to reduce sync conflicts .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: When to Contact Support
items.text:
• If messages consistently fail to sync after re-linking.
  • If critical business data is lost during re-sync.
üìå Messcat‚Äôs WhatsApp integration relies on WhatsApp Web‚Äôs infrastructure, which has inherent sync limitations. For mission-critical workflows, consider switching to the **WhatsApp Business API** (supports full message history sync) .
path: WhatsApp Messages Not Syncing to Mobile (Sender‚Äôs Device)

items.title: Seamlessly Reconnecting After a Long Time/Migrating to a New Number
items.text:
How to seamlessly migrate a channel to a new number, or reconnect the same number after changing to a new phone, or just reconnect after a long time

Changing the WhatsApp phone number connected to a channel in Messcat is a straightforward process. Following this guide will ensure you do not lose any running automations nor your chat history on Messcat.

Note: Any groups you were part of with the old number will have to be rejoined. Till then, you won‚Äôt be able to message on those groups

You can follow this guide in case your phone number got banned, and you‚Äôre reconnecting the same number, or you installed the same phone number on a new phone or simply reconnecting after having been disconnected for a while

  1. On the Messcat dashboard, navigate to the Manage Channels page

  2. Locate the channel that you want to change the number for and click ‚ÄúScan QR‚Äù

  3. You will be prompted to disconnect your current phone number. Click ‚ÄúOK‚Äù.

  4. If you are worried about the WhatsApp sync overriding the archive, pin, unread chats on your system, disable ‚ÄúNative Chat Action Sync‚Äù before reconnecting. You can read more about this in our guide here

  5. You may be prompted with a message in case you had lots of pending messages queued up. This can happen if you were disconnected for a long time & had some automation triggering new messages ‚Äî but these could not be sent out as you were disconnected. To avoid being banned & loss of the scheduled messages ‚Äî choose the recommended action here. The order of the messages being sent is preserved.

    Note: if your new number does not have history with the chats you messaged with the old number, and you have dozens of chats that have pending messages ‚Äî this can potentially result in a ban. In this case, you can choose to ‚ÄúDelete All Pending Messages‚Äù too

  6. Finally, scan the QR with your new phone number and you have your new channel connected with a new number! Any previously synced messages & chats will be there & merged with any new data that comes in from the new number
path: Seamlessly Reconnecting After a Long Time/Migrating to a New Number

items.title: Starting With a Fresh Inbox

This will keep all contacts, tags, assignees, notes & scheduled messages ‚Äî but will remove synced chats & messages. Please keep in mind ‚Äî this action cannot be undone

items.title: Why are my messages not syncing?
items.text:
Article Description: Outdated Draft Last Updated: November 5, 2024 Published: No Suggested: No

If your messages are not synced as expected between Whatsapp and Messcat, these might be some potential reasons:

  1. Your channel is not Connected
  2. If your Chat history sync status is "waiting", that means that your chats are still being synced. Please wait for all your chats to be imported from Whatsapp
  3. Messcat and Whatsapp are separate platforms. As a result, there may be synchronisation delays between them. Depending on the number of messages in your chats, it can take a few minutes to hours for your message history to appear on linked devices. If you are still not able to view the history as expected, you can try to backup chat on your WhatsApp phone and see if the contact's conversation reappears. If not, you can report it to WhatsApp's official customer support

  4. If your message sent appears to be incomplete when viewed on Whatsapp Web, this is a syncing issue on Whatsapp‚Äôs end. Please be assured that your recipient has received the whole message on their mobile phones, but WhatsApp is not able to display is correctly

  5. Sometimes when you send the first message through Messcat, Whatsapp web may not be able to display this information and show ‚Äúwaiting for this message‚Äù. WhatsApp will auto-correct error within an unknown period of time(usually under 24 hours)

https://help.Messcat.tech/inbox-/fZtwDNaJhZrhvo3UfHtK5f/how-to-fix-‚Äúmessage-is-not-available‚Äù-issue/eWRaHBJDyKQnDZmv2SrVaq

  1. **Full message history not present** - The entire message history for multi-device connection is not supported by WhatsApp. Some chats may have more history than other chats, Whatsapp Web may have more or less history for some chats ‚Äî it‚Äôs very flaky

  2. Users may send a message that contains buttons with URL that is not able to be received by some Android/iPhone users. In such cases, you can paste the link into the message flow/template and you‚Äôll be able to send it out to recipients successfully

  3. Contact names updated in Whatsapp will not necessarily be auto-updated in Messcat. You will need to change the contact name manually

  4. Some messages may be shown as failed to send on Messcat due to being rejected by the recipients themselves. This means that some people may have marked you as spam or you may have sent broadcast messages to too many new people too quickly. This is usually temporary and gets resolved on its own in a few hours. However, the failed messages will not be auto-sent

items.title: Two types of Whatsapp Bans
items.text:
1. Temporary Ban ‚Äì A temporary WhatsApp ban is for minor policy violations, like using an unsupported version or spam-like activities(but not malicious). Users can't access their accounts for a few hours to several days, with a countdown showing the ban duration.
  2. Permanent Ban ‚Äì Permanent bans are for severe or repeated policy violations, such as harmful content, spamming, or being blocked by many users quickly. Once banned, an account can't be reactivated; users must start a new one with a different number. While WhatsApp‚Äôs decision may be final in majority of cases, an appeal can be made to get your account back.

items.title: For a Permanent Ban ‚Äì
items.text:
If your WhatsApp account is permanently banned, you'll see the message "This account is not allowed to use WhatsApp." Permanent bans are typically irreversible. However, if you believe you were wrongly banned, you can appeal the ban to request unbanning your account.

Follow the process below.

  1. Appeal the Ban: If it‚Äôs a permanent ban, you‚Äôll need to appeal to WhatsApp. Open the app, where you‚Äôll see a screen informing you of the ban. Click on ‚ÄúContact Us‚Äù, ‚ÄùSupport‚Äù.

  2. Write Your Appeal: In the text field/email, write your appeal. Clearly state that you believe your account has been banned unfairly and request a review. Be polite and professional in your communication and include relevant details that can help your case. Explain how this was unintentional and would not happen again, and that losing this WhatsApp number may impact your business significantly. Promise to use WhatsApp responsibly.

  3. Send Your Appeal: Once you‚Äôve written your appeal, click ‚ÄúSend‚Äù. It may take a few days for WhatsApp to respond, so be patient.

After lodging your appeal, await the team‚Äôs response. They might ask for further information or detail the next steps. Depending on the severity of your alleged violation, your account might be reinstated, or the ban may remain.

Please include an explanation of your actions and commitment to follow WhatsApp's policies in your appeal message. Note that WhatsApp receives many similar requests, so it may take time for them to review and respond to your case.

Please note: The outcome depends on WhatsApp and your ban may not be revoked if you‚Äôve been banned multiple times before for violating their policies.

items.title: First Step: Ask for a Review in the App
items.text:
If you think WhatsApp banned your account by mistake:

  1. Open WhatsApp on your phone.
  2. You should see a message saying your account is banned. Tap Request a review.
  3. WhatsApp will check your case. This might take some time.
  4. You can open WhatsApp again later to check the status of your request.
  5. Important: Sending more than one request will not speed up the review.
  6. WhatsApp will send you a message in the app when they finish their review and make a decision.

items.title: If You Need to Email WhatsApp Support: Tips & Templates
items.text: Sometimes you might need to email WhatsApp support, especially if the in-app review doesn't work or you need to provide more detail. Here are some tips and examples.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: Important Tips for Your Email
items.text:
• Be polite in your message.
  • Explain clearly what happened from your side.
  • If you think you made a mistake, admit it.
  • Promise that you will follow WhatsApp's rules carefully in the future.
  • Make it personal: This is very important! Explain how you use WhatsApp for your business and how much the ban hurts your business. This can really help your chances of getting unbanned.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.text: Find the reason below that best matches why you think you were banned. Use the template as a starting point for your email, but remember to add your own personal details based on the tips above.

path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: Situation 1: Sending Too Many Messages or Spam
items.text:
• Why this happens: WhatsApp might ban you if you send lots of messages to people who didn't ask for them, or send the same message over and over.
  • Suggested Template:
Dear WhatsApp Support,

I think my number was banned because I was sending many messages from my WhatsApp Business account. I promise I didn't mean to trick anyone receiving the messages.

I admit I didn't fully know all the rules about messaging, but I have learned them now. I will be very careful to follow the guidelines in the future.

Could you please reconsider and unban my number? WhatsApp is very important for my business [Explain briefly how, e.g., communicating with customers]. Losing it is causing problems [Explain briefly, e.g., difficult to contact customers].

Thank you.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: Situation 2: Making Many Groups with Unknown Contacts
items.text:
• Why this happens: Quickly making lots of groups with people you haven't saved as contacts can look suspicious to WhatsApp and lead to a ban.
  • Suggested Template:
Dear WhatsApp Support,

I recently made several groups, and I think this might be why my number was banned. These groups were for a special community event I was organizing for my loyal customers [Explain briefly if possible].

I am sorry if making these groups broke any rules. I have reviewed the guidelines now and will be careful to follow them in the future.

Could you please restore my account? Connecting with my customers on WhatsApp is essential for [mention your business goal briefly].

Thank you.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: Situation 3: Getting Blocked or Reported A Lot
items.text:
• Why this happens: If many different people block or report your number, WhatsApp might think you are doing something wrong and ban you.
  • Suggested Template:
Dear WhatsApp Support,

I understand that maybe many users have blocked or reported my number. I'm honestly not sure why this happened, but I promise to carefully follow all WhatsApp guidelines from now on.

I would really appreciate it if you could please reconsider and unban my account. Using WhatsApp helps my business by [mention brief benefit], and this ban makes it hard to [mention brief impact].

Thank you.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: Situation 4: Using Unofficial WhatsApp Apps
items.text:
• Why this happens: Using fake WhatsApp versions (like GBWhatsApp, WhatsApp Plus) or other apps not approved by WhatsApp can get you banned. These apps break WhatsApp's rules and can be unsafe for your data.
  • Suggested Template:
Dear WhatsApp Support,

I am writing to ask you to please reactivate my WhatsApp account that was recently banned. I believe it might be because I was using an external app to manage my account.

I truly did not know that using tools like this was against the rules. I have now deleted that app and made sure I am only using the official WhatsApp version from the app store.

I have learned my lesson and will only use the official app. Please consider unbanning my number, as it's important for [mention brief business need].

items.title: Situation 5: Breaking Other WhatsApp Rules (General)

I am sorry that I broke the WhatsApp Terms of Service. I might have done this by mistake [mention briefly what you think you did wrong, if you know].

items.title: Handle Pending Messages Before Reconnecting to Messcat
items.text:
Article Description: Essential to prevent another Ban.

Pending messages occur when your WhatsApp channel disconnects from Messcat, preventing messages from being sent. This can result in a backlog of messages to be sent if disconnected for a few hours to a few days.

To minimize the risk of getting banned, especially after being unblocked by WhatsApp, it is recommended to clear/slowly reschedule pending messages before reconnecting to Messcat.

This guide also explains how to clear failed messages, which are messages that could not be delivered due to errors.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans
Handle Pending Messages Before Reconnecting to Messcat

items.title: Handling Pending Messages Before Reconnecting
items.text:
Follow these steps to handle pending messages:

  1. Click on the user menu button in the top-right corner and select Manage Channels.

  2. Locate the specific channel and click on Clear Message Queue.

  3. A popup will appear with two options:

    • Keep Pending Messages and Reconnect (‚ö† This may pose a risk of being flagged or banned).

    • Delete All Pending Messages and Reconnect
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans
Handle Pending Messages Before Reconnecting to Messcat

items.title: Understanding the Options
items.text:
• Keep Pending Messages and Reconnect: If messages were scheduled to be sent during the disconnection, they will immediately go out after reconnecting.
  • Delete All Pending Messages and Reconnect: Clears all pending/scheduled messages before reconnecting. This is the recommended option to avoid the risk of being flagged or banned.

Example Scenarios:

  • If a message was scheduled to send within 5 minutes, but you reconnect after 10 minutes, it will send immediately.
  • If a message is scheduled for a day later, it will still be sent as planned after reconnection.
  • Click on Delete All Pending Messages and Reconnect to clear the pending messages.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans
Handle Pending Messages Before Reconnecting to Messcat

items.title: Clearing Failed Messages
items.text:
Failed messages are those that were not sent due to errors and differ from pending messages. Follow these steps to clear failed messages:

  1. Click on the user menu button in the top-right corner and select Failed Messages.

  2. A list of all failed messages will appear.

    • Resend individual messages by clicking the Send Message button next to each failed message.
    • Alternatively, clear specific failed messages or take bulk actions:
      • Clear All: Deletes all failed messages.
      • Resend All: Resends all failed messages (‚ö† This may pose a risk of being flagged or banned).

  3. Click on Clear All to delete all failed messages.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: FAQs related to WhatsApp Bans
items.text:
Article Description: Some common FAQs

  1. How to Unban My WhatsApp Number? If WhatsApp has banned your number, contact their support team via the "Contact Us" button in the app. Provide a clear explanation of your situation and request them to unban your account. The review process may take some time, and unbanning is subject to WhatsApp's discretion.
  2. Reasons for WhatsApp Number Ban? WhatsApp bans numbers for violating its Terms of Service, such as sending spam, sharing inappropriate content, or being reported for suspicious activities.
  3. What to Do if Your WhatsApp Number is Banned? Appeal to WhatsApp support by sending an email explaining your situation and requesting to lift the ban.
  4. Preventing Future WhatsApp Bans? Avoid future bans by adhering to WhatsApp‚Äôs Terms of Service, which include avoiding spam, inappropriate content, and suspicious activities.
  5. Duration for Unbanning WhatsApp Number? The ban review process can vary, typically taking 48 hours or more. WhatsApp does not guarantee a specific timeframe for unbanning.
  6. Meaning of ‚ÄúThis Account is Not Allowed to Use WhatsApp‚Äù Message? This message indicates a ban due to activities violating WhatsApp's Terms of Service, such as spamming, inappropriate content, or being flagged by users.
  7. Consequences of a WhatsApp Number Ban? A banned account is barred from using Whatsapp, its data is lost and cannot be recovered. The number displays a ban message and cannot be use to sign up again.
  8. Will my chats get lost after getting UnBanned? No your chats will most likely be saved after you‚Äôre unabanned.
  9. Would I receive messages on my Banned Number? Yes, you may receive messages on your banned number, however, you will only be able to see them if you‚Äôre unbanned.
  10. Is Instant Unbanning Possible on WhatsApp? No. After appealing, WhatsApp's team reviews your case, but there's no set timeframe for a decision.
  11. Quick Steps to Unban Your WhatsApp Number? Determine if your ban is temporary or permanent. If permanent and unjust, contact support quickly with a clear and polite explanation. Prompt and clear communication may expedite the review process.
  12. My WhatsApp number got banned after scanning into Messcat It‚Äôs probably because you did not clear pending messages before scanning the QR, causing pending messages to be sent. We recommend you warm up (use it normally to signal normal usage) a number after being unbanned before rescanning into Messcat.
path: Everything you need to know about WhatsApp Bans

items.title: How to import contacts in Messcat
items.text: Importing contacts into Messcat helps you quickly build your audience for broadcasting. This guide explains the step-by-step process for importing contacts, as well as how to customize and enhance your import by adding tags, custom fields, and more for better contact management.

items.title: Importing Contacts into Messcat
items.text:
Follow these steps to import your contacts:

  1. Navigate to Contacts
    • From the Messcat dashboard, go to the left-hand menu. Select Contact Management, then click Contacts.
  2. Click Import
    • Find and click the Import button located in the top right corner of the Contacts page.

  3. Download the Template

    • Messcat provides a CSV template to help you format your contacts correctly. Download the template that suits your needs, whether it's for email broadcasting or non-email contacts.

    ‚úèÔ∏è

    Understanding the Template Options:

    Email Broadcast Template: Use this template for contacts who will receive email broadcasts.

    Non-Email Template: Use this template for contacts who will be reached via other channels (e.g., WhatsApp, SMS).

  4. Prepare Your Contacts

    • Fill in the template with your contact details, ensuring each contact is on a separate line. Save the completed file in CSV (comma-separated values) format.
  5. Import Your List
    • Back in Messcat, click Import again. Browse and select your prepared CSV file, then click Upload to begin importing your contacts.

  6. Preview and Customize What You Want to Upload

    • A popup will appear showing all the details of your uploaded CSV file. Here, you can customize each column‚Äôs significance, such as selecting which column corresponds to name, phone number, tags, custom fields, and any other relevant data.
    • Enhance the Upload: You can improve your contact import by adding tags to categorize your contacts and create custom fields for additional information like customer status, location, or subscription type. These customizations help you segment your audience and send more targeted broadcasts.

  7. Import Contacts

    • Once you‚Äôve reviewed and customized the details, click Import Contacts at the bottom right of the popup to complete the import process. Your contacts are now successfully imported with the desired tags and custom fields!
path: How to import contacts in Messcat

items.title: Filtering Your Contacts in Messcat
items.text: The Filter feature in Messcat provides a powerful way to manage your client list by segmenting contacts based on various attributes, such as tags, messages sent, and more. This makes it easier to organize and target your audience for more efficient communication.

items.title: Where to Find Filters
items.text: You can find the filter option on the Contacts Page, next to the search icon.

items.title: How to Use Filters
items.text: You can filter your contact list based on the following attributes:

items.title: 1. Chat
items.text:
• Filter by Individual Chats or Groups: You can filter contacts based on their chats or groups.
  • Unread Messages: Filter contacts based on whether they have unread messages from you.

items.title: 2. Tag
items.text:
You can apply tag filters in two ways:

  • Tag is: This filter shows all contacts that have the selected tag(s) applied.
  • Tag is not: This works as a second condition. For example, if you filter by Tag is "A", and want to exclude contacts with Tag B, you can select Tag is not "B". This will show contacts with Tag A but not Tag B.

Additionally, you can filter based on:

  • Date Range: When the tagwas added.
  • Team Member: Who added the tag.

items.title: 3. Custom Fields
items.text:
You can filter based on custom fields in two ways:

  • Selected Custom Field: This shows all contacts that have data inside the selected custom field.
  • Custom is or is not: This works as a second condition for the selected custom field.

For example, if you filter by Birthday and select is "January", you'll get all contacts with that exact birthday. Then, if you add is not "February", you'll exclude contacts whose birthday is in February.

Additionally, you can filter based on:

  • Date Range: When the custom field data was added.
  • Team Member: Who added the custom field data.

For example, you can filter by the "Purchase Value" custom field to find contacts whose purchase value was recorded by the sales team between January 1st and March 31st.

items.title: 4. Channel
items.text: • Filter by Channel: You can filter contacts based on the channel where their number is saved (e.g., WhatsApp, SMS).

items.title: 5. Assignee
items.text:
• Filter by Assignee: You can filter contacts assigned to specific team members. You can use "is" and "is not" conditions to include or exclude contacts assigned to particular team members.

Additionally, you can filter based on:

  • Date Range: When the contact was assigned.
  • Team Member: Who assigned the contact.

items.title: 6. Ticket
items.text: • Filter by Ticket: You can filter contacts based on whether they have tickets in a particular CRM board or at a specific ticket stage within that board.

items.title: 7. Message Received
items.text: • Filter by Received Messages: You can filter contacts based on the number of messages they have sent to you, using greater than and less than filters.

items.title: 8. Message Sent
items.text: • Filter by Sent Messages: You can filter contacts based on the number of messages you have sent to them, using greater than and less than filters.

items.title: 9. Last Contact is
items.text: • Filter by Last Interaction Date: You can filter contacts based on the date of their last interaction with you, selecting a specific date range using the calendar picker.

items.title: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management
items.text:
Imagine this: Your customer support team is managing tickets in your CRM, and every time a customer interacts with your business, a new ticket gets created. Now, instead of resolving issues efficiently, your team is drowning in duplicate tickets for the same contact. üòµ‚Äçüí´

Here‚Äôs another scenario: You have a setup where tickets are created automatically, but once a ticket is resolved, there‚Äôs no way to reopen the system for a new ticket without manual intervention. Sounds frustrating, right? üòñ

This is where the One Ticket Per Contact Flow comes to the rescue! üéâ

  • No Duplicate Tickets: It ensures only one active ticket per contact is allowed at a time, keeping your CRM organized.
  • Re-enabling Ticket Creation: Once a ticket is closed, the flow reopens the system for new tickets, fully automated.
  • Customizable: Easily adjust triggers, ticket names, board stages, and more to fit your business needs.

Let‚Äôs dive into how this flow works and how you can tailor it to streamline your CRM workflows!

üìå ### **Important Pre-Requisites** 1. **CRM Setup**: - Create a **new CRM board** dedicated to this setup. - Alternatively, ensure your existing CRM board contains only **one ticket or no ticket per contact**. - This prevents issues caused by multiple tickets per contact. 2. **Enable Triggers**: - Once you import the template into your team, make sure to **enable all triggers** in the flow. - Without enabling the triggers, the flow will not work as intended.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: How the Flow Works
items.text:
This message flow uses smart automation to check for existing tickets before creating a new one, tag contacts to track ticket status, and even re-enable ticket creation after closure. You can start using it with the provided Message Flow Template.

Here‚Äôs a detailed breakdown:
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 1: Setting the Event Trigger
items.text:
• Default Trigger in Template:

    The flow is triggered by an incoming message.

  • Customizable Options:

    You can change the trigger to better match your use case, such as:

    • Contact Updated (Learn more)
    • New Contact (Learn more)
    • New Chat Started (Learn more)
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 2: Using the Condition Node
items.text:
The Condition Node is at the heart of the flow. It prevents duplicate tickets by checking if the contact has a specific tag (default: Ticket Checker).

  • Tag Setup:
    • In the template, this tag is set as a Flow Variable for easy updates across the flow.
    • Learn more about Flow Variables here.

If the tag exists, no new ticket is created. If it doesn‚Äôt, the flow moves to the next step.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 3: Creating a Ticket
items.text:
When the Condition Node allows it, the Create Ticket Node is activated.

  • Customizing Ticket Details:
    • Ticket Name: Use custom fields and predefined variables like {{Name}} or {{Phone Number}} to dynamically personalize ticket names. Learn about available variables here.
    • Board Stage: Set this using the Flow Variable Ticket Board and Stage for centralized management.

For a deeper understanding of the Create Ticket Node, click here.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 4: Tagging the Contact
items.text:
After creating the ticket, the Modify Contact Node adds the Ticket Checker tag to the contact.

  • Purpose: This tag ensures the flow skips creating another ticket if triggered again.
  • Default Configuration: The template uses the Ticket Checker Flow Variable to manage this step.

For a deeper understanding of the Modify Contact Node, click here.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 5: Adding Custom Steps (Optional)
items.text:
Feel free to add more steps, such as:

  • Sending a confirmation message to the contact.
  • Adding a delay for processing time.
  • Triggering additional automated actions.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Step 6: Re-enabling Ticket Creation for Closed Tickets (Highly Recommended)
items.text:
Want to automatically create tickets for a contact again after their current ticket is closed? Here‚Äôs how to do it:

  1. Add a Ticket Updated Trigger.
  2. Connect the trigger to a Condition Node that checks if the ticket is in the last stage (e.g., "Closed").
    • The template uses the Flow Variable: Last Stage for Removing Tag.
  3. Connect the Condition Node to a Modify Contact Node that removes the Ticket Checker tag.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Why Step 6 is a Game-Changer?
items.text: Without this step, you‚Äôd need to manually manage tags to allow new tickets after closure. With it, your system is fully automated, ensuring a seamless workflow for repeat interactions.
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: Start Using the Flow
items.text:
To access the flow variables follow these steps:

  • Open the ‚Äúhorizontal 3 dots‚Äù menu in the top-right corner.
  • Click ‚ÄúFlow Variables‚Äù to view and edit all flow variables used in this template.

Ready to optimize your ticketing system? Import the Message Flow Template, customize it to your needs, and experience a streamlined, automated CRM setup.

For further guidance, reach out to our support team anytime!
path: One Ticket Per Contact: Simplify Your CRM Management

items.title: What are Custom Fields?
items.text:
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jmYOzIhcf9k6C5I_CMEB7GQHrV4G0OAL/view?usp=drive_link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jmYOzIhcf9k6C5I_CMEB7GQHrV4G0OAL/view?usp=drive_link)

Custom Fields let you create and personalize data for each contact, making communication easier.

items.title: Key Features
items.text:
• Create Custom Parameters: Set unique parameters for individual contacts.
  • Personalisation: Customise each parameter, such as assigning 'address', 'phone number', and more.
  • Automated Insertion: Use the parameter name in the inbox to auto-fill its full details, like "Pepsi" when sending messages.
  • Streamlined Communication: Simplifies sending tailored information quickly and accurately.

items.title: Types of Custom Fields
items.text:
• Text: Store textual information.
  • Number: Record numerical values.
  • Link: Save URLs for easy access.
  • Attachment: Attach files directly to contacts.
  • Single Dropdown: Choose from a predefined list of options.
  • Team Member: Assign a team member to a contact.
  • CheckBox: Mark options as selected or not.
  • Phone Number: Store contact phone numbers.
  • Timestamp: Record date and time information.

This feature enables more efficient and personalised communication by allowing you to tailor data parameters for each contact.

items.title: How to use custom Fields?
items.text:
Let's take an example here, as you saw in the visual above, I have created a custom field named "Company", which includes the 3 options - "Pepsi", ‚ÄúCocaCola‚Äù, ‚ÄúMesscat‚Äù. So you must be thinking about how to use it.

Well, we can use this custom field in the inbox. When you write '{', a dropdown of all your custom fields will appear. You can select the one you want, and it will send the data inside the custom field as the message.

In this case, when you select the "Company" custom field in the dropdown and send the message, it will appear as "Pepsi" in the chat.

items.title: What is Order Status?
items.text: There are three types of status in inbox order management which can be used by the client as they see fit, but here is some explanation about the statuses:
path: How to manage orders from inbox?

items.title: Types of Status
items.text:
1. Order Status: This status is about whether the order is completed or not. It has three status options:
    1. Completed: The order has been paid for.
    2. Pending: The order is confirmed but not yet received by the customer.
    3. Cancelled: The order is cancelled.
  2. Payment Status: This status is about whether the order is paid for or not. It has three status options:
    1. Paid: The order is confirmed and paid for.
    2. Pending: The order details are confirmed but the payment hasn't been done.
    3. Expired: The order payment link that was sent to the customer has expired.

  3. Shipping Status: This status is about whether the order is shipped or not. It has four options:

    1. Delivered: The order has been delivered and received by the customer.
    2. Pending: The order shipping is pending i.e. It is not out for delivery to the customer or the customer didn't take the delivery
    3. Shipped: The order has been dispatched from the client side.
    4. Cancelled: The shipping has been cancelled for a specific reason.
path: How to manage orders from inbox?
